abstract: Manhattan District Atty Cyrus Vance Jr will use $38 million received in settlements from international banks in New York to pay for testing 56,000 rape kits languishing in city and county police storage rooms around the country; hopes that push, which fulfills vow he made in 2014, will eliminate national backlog.
lead_paragraph: The Manhattan district attorney, Cyrus R. Vance Jr., is sending money to cities around the country to pay for the testing of 56,000 backlogged rape kits.

headline.main: New York City Prosecutor Using Millions Taken From Banks for Rape-Kit Testing
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Fulfills Vow on Rape-Kit Tests

snippet: The Manhattan district attorney, Cyrus R. Vance Jr., is sending money to cities around the country to pay for the testing of 56,000 backlogged rape kits.

keywords.value: Office of the Chief Medical Examiner of the City of New York
keywords.name: organizations
